answers.answer: My two pregnancies have been way different as well. I was swelling pretty early, but my doctor wasn't worried until my blood pressure rose around 38 weeks. As long as your blood pressure is not high and you don't have protein in your urine, you're probably fine. But make sure these things get checked because swelling can be an indicator of preeclampsia.

Thanks alot ill mention it to my doc. So far my bp has been great and im not having headaches so i pray its just a normal pregnancy thing....i did wear shoes today which i normally wear flip flops so that may have something to do with it....

question: Hi everyone this is my first post on here and i am am currently 22 weeks pregnant with my 2nd child....and i am curious is it normal for my feet to be swelling this early in pregnancy...with my first child i had no pregnancy syptoms at all none..with this one ive been so sick and i am having all the pregnancy syptoms u could poss. have....
title: swelling....
